channel.title: Http on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Http on TLDRBins

item.title: Advance curl
item.description: Advance curl # POST url-encoded data curl --data-urlencode '<QUERY_STRING>' <TARGET> # Put the POST data to url and use GET curl -G --data-urlencode '<QUERY_STRING>' <TARGET> # PUT a file curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # PUT a file (with creds) curl -X PUT -u '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' <TARGET>/<FILE> -d @<FILE> # Put a file as raw binary format (preserve newlines and control characters) curl -X PUT <TARGET>/<FILE> --data-binary @<FILE> # POST a file with form param 'file' curl -X POST -F 'file=@<FILE>p;type=<APPLICATION_TYPE>;filename=<FILE>' <TARGET> # POST a file in raw-text format (not as attachment) with form param 'file' curl -X POST -F 'file=<<FILE>' <TARGET> # Not to handle sequences of '/.

item.title: Advance wget
item.description: Advance wget # Provide a file with urls wget --input-file <FILE_PATH> # POST a file wget --post-file <FILE_PATH> <TARGET> # Overwrite a file wget <TARGET>/<FILE> -O <FILE_PATH>

item.title: Subdomain Enum
item.description: Add domain/subdomain to /etc/hosts echo "<TARGET> <DOMAIN>" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts wfuzz gobuster wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" -u http://<DOMAIN> Take note of the word size, Ctrl+C to interrupt the process, then run again wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Host: FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" -u http://<DOMAIN> --hw 10 Filter out response with header # For example: Access-Control-Allow-Origin wfuzz -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.txt -H "Origin: http://FUZZ.<DOMAIN>" --filter "r.headers.response ~ 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin'" -u http://<DOMAIN> gobuster vhost -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/bitquark-subdomains-top100000.

item.title: Webdav
item.description: Tools davtest curl # Without creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> # With creds davtest -url http://<TARGET> -auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>' Ref: Download davtest # Rename a remote file curl -X MOVE -H 'Destination:http://<TARGET>/<NEW_FILENAME>' http://<TARGET>/<FILE>
